form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Reed introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend title XII of the Public Health Service Act to expand the definition of trauma to include thermal, electrical, chemical, radioactive, and other extrinsic agents.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improving Trauma Care Act of 2014.

subsection.header: Revised definition under trauma systems grants programs
subsection.text: Paragraph (4) of section 1231 of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300d–31) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term trauma means an injury resulting from exposure to—

subparagraph.text: another extrinsic agent, including an extrinsic agent that is thermal, electrical, chemical, or radioactive.

subsection.header: Revised definition under interagency program for trauma research
subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 1261(h) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300d–61(h)) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The term trauma means an injury resulting from exposure to—

subparagraph.text: another extrinsic agent, including an extrinsic agent that is thermal, electrical, chemical, or radioactive.
